channel.title: Convolution on bcdata
channel.description: Recent content in Convolution on bcdata

item.title: Interpolating ship paths in the Port of Metro Vancouver.
item.description: Mentor: Cameron Wallace Summary TBA Data team notes Each set of data spans approximately one week. Historical records contain many ships with sparsely recorded data (once every five minutes per ship), while Current records store as many points as possible. The goal is to reconstruct full paths from partial information. This problem is ripe for Kalman filters and Latent Dirichlet Allocation.
